name: My Sister
description:
My Sister

was a hawkmoth.
My sister was heartbeat, dust
in the hands, diurnal wormglow. 
 
My sister was a chestnut, 
tight in our mother’s womb
that I spoke to.

My sister watched for star fragments 
flashing to the sea. My sister was a red
trout, a talisman, a dirigible.

My sister was the riverbank and the hitch.
My sister ran with the pack. My sister ran 
to hereafter, to the sound of wolfblood 

boiling in her heels.
